intro: Malvastrum operculatum, commonly known as the common mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
